result.execSummary:
All charges against Brian Spinner in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Spinner is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Victim also present in court. bond quashed. State to efile a civil complaint, FO case to be opened. Upon motion of the State this case is dismissed. court Grants. Defendant pleads guilty to civil complaint. Court orders $250 fine plus costs. 30 days to pay. Minutes filed.

records.addlTxt: Victims request to lift no contact
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 1-25-2022 - Defendant shall have no violent contact with victims MMS, LR, or AR. Defendant may not reside with MMS.   "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

DEFENDANT TO POST $150.00 CASH - already posted.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.M.S., L.R. AND A.R.  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Citation - DC/DA repeater
SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS

Defendant Brian Spinner appeared in Court. James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given to defendant; referred to SPD. Received citation over the weekend. Minutes filed.
